title: Sokol Maliqi
text:
Sokol Maliqi (<a href="Serbo-Croatian">Serbo-Croat</a>: "Sokol Malići") (born 24 December 1981, in <a href="Pristina">Pristina</a>, <a href="SFR%20Yugoslavia">SFR Yugoslavia</a>, now <a href="Kosovo">Kosovo</a> ) is a retired <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a>/<a href="Kosovar%20Albanian">Kosovar Albanian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> and current head coach of <a href="FC%20Kosova%20Z%C3%BCrich">FC Kosova</a>.
Career.
Coaching career.
Maliqi started his coaching career in April 2012 as a player-coach at <a href="FC%20Schwamendingen">FC Schwamendingen</a>. On 15 May 2013 it was confirmed, that he would join <a href="FC%20D%C3%BCbendorf">FC Dübendorf</a> from the upcoming season, also as a player-coach. He left the position two years later and then had a brief spell with <a href="FC%20Ruggell">FC Ruggell</a>.
In the summer 2016, he joined <a href="FC%20Gossau%20ZH">FC Gossau ZH</a>, still as a player-coach. He left the position at the end of 2017, to become player-coach of <a href="FC%20Uzwil">FC Uzwil</a>. On 20 April 2020 it was confirmed, that Maliqi had been appointed head coach of his former club, <a href="FC%20Kosova%20Z%C3%BCrich">FC Kosova</a>.
